['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~bs/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~varun/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~muslim/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ramesho/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~varun']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~varun/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~varun']

<title>Dr. Rajeshwari Dutt << IIT Mandi</title>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Rajeshwari Dutt</h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<img src="images/rajeshwari.png"  width="180px" height="190px"/>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<th>Phone: </th>   <td>01905-237919</td>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<th>EMail:  </th>	<td>rdutt[at]iitmandi[dot]ac[dot]in</td>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<th>Address: </th>	<td>School of Humanities and Social Sciences</td>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~manu/']


<li>Latin American history and culture</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Indigenous and agrarian studies</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Social and cultural history</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Comparative India and Latin America</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Ph.D. in Social and Cultural History, Carnegie Mellon University, PA, (USA), 2012<br>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


 (Title: Managing the Interstices: Cacique Politics in Late Colonial and Early National Yucatn)</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>M.A. in History, Carnegie Mellon University, PA, (USA), 2007</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>M. Phil. Centre for Studies in Social Sciences Calcutta, India (CSSSCAL), 2005</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>B.A. Franklin and Marshall College, PA (USA), magna cum laude, 2004</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<h5>Research Experience</h5>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<ul><li>Doctoral dissertation research at Archivo General del Estado de Yucatan (AGEY) Merida, Mexico, 2009-Present</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Research Assistant, Department of History, Carnegie Mellon University, 2007-2008</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Completed Research Training Program at the Centre for Studies in Social Sciences, Kolkata, 2005</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Hackman Summer Research Fellow, Franklin & Marshall College, Lancaster, PA, 2001-2002</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Assistant Professor, School of Humanities and Social Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Mandi, Fall 2012- present</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Instructor, Department of History, Carnegie Mellon University, Spring 2012</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Head Teaching Assistant, World History Course, Department of History, Carnegie Mellon University, 2010-2011</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Teaching Assistant, World History Course, Department of History, Carnegie Mellon University, 2006-2008</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Writing Tutor, Writing Center, Franklin & Marshall College, Lancaster, PA, 2002-2004</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Preceptor, First Year Seminar, Franklin & Marshall College, Lancaster, PA, 2003</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Member, Research Execom, IIT Mandi, 2013</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Graduate student representative, Foreign Student Advisory Committee, Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA, 2011-2012</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Front desk, Merida English Language Library (MELL), Merida, Mexico, 2009</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Student worker, Library preservations, archives and special collections, Shadek-Fackenthal Library, Franklin & Marshall, Lancaster, PA, 2000-2004</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Curator, Exhibit of WWI posters in the Dana Gallery of the Phillips Museum Art at Franklin & Marshall, Lancaster, PA, 2002</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']

<h3>Journal Publications</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~pjana/']


<li><b>Dutt, Rajeshwari</b>, Crossing Over: Caciques, Indigenous Politics and the Vecino World in Caste War Yucatn, Ethnohistory, Duke University Press (forthcoming).</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Dasgupta, <b>Rajeshwari</b> (2008). Honor in Early Spanish America: A Case Study of Conquistadores in Sixteenth Century Tucumn. Hispanic Horizon, 26, 123-153.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Dasgupta, <b>Rajeshwari</b> (2006). Towards the "new man": revolutionary youth and rural agency in the Naxalite movement. Economic and Political Weekly, 41(19).</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<h3>International Conferences</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li><b>Dutt, Rajeshwari</b>, Webs of Power: Cacique Politicization in Post-Independence Yucatn, Latin American Studies Association Congress, Washington D.C., June 1, 2013 (upcoming).</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li><b>Dutt, Rajeshwari</b>, Becoming Political: Mayan Caciques in Early National Yucatn, Plenary talk (via skype) in Yucatan in PA Roundtable Conference at University of Pennsylvania, Philadephia, March 1, 2013.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li><b>Dutt, Rajeshwari</b>. Crossing Over: Caciques, Indigenous Politics and the Vecino World in Caste War Yucatan in Department of History Graduate Forum, Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1, 2011.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li><b>Dutt, Rajeshwari</b>. Getting Personal: Caciques as Political Intermediaries in Colonial Yucatan, in Yucatan in PA Roundtable Conference at Penn State University, State College, February 24, 2011.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Dasgupta, <b>Rajeshwari</b>. Negotiating the Revolution: Hacendado Strategies in Yucatan in the early Twentieth Century in Department of History Graduate Forum, Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA, January 25, 2007.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']


<li>Dasgupta, <b>Rajeshwari</b>. Marxism and the World Stage: A Case Study of the dynamics of peasant-state relations in left ruled West Bengal. Rethinking Marxism Conference, November 8, 2003 at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~rdutt/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ashok/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ashok/']

<h3>Conference Papers</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ashok/']


<li>Paper titled 'Religious Celebrations: Terrains of Protest and Contestation for Social Status in India' was presented at the second International Conference on Religion and Spirituality in Society during 20-22 February 2012 held at University of British Columbia, Vancouver, Canada.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ashok/']


<li>Paper titled 'Merging Caste with Congregation: Lutheran Christian practice in Coastal Andhra, South India' was presented in European Conference on Modern Asian Studies (ECMSAS, 2010) during 26- 29th July, 2010 held at University of Bonn, Germany. </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ashok/']


<li>Paper titled 'Christianity, Caste and Structurally imposed Marginality: A Sociological Study of Lutheran Church in Contemporary South India' was presented in 7th Annual South Asia Graduate Conference during 16-17th April 2010 held at University of Chicago, USA.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ashok/']


Paper titled 'Caste Identity and Combating Marginality: A case of Lutheran Christians in coastal Andhra Pradesh, South India' was presented in an International Colloquium on "Mission at and from the Margins" during 23-27 September, 2009 held at the Henry Martyn Institute, Hyderabad, India.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ashok/']

<h3>Research Interests: </h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sudhir/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~tulika/']


<li>Understanding the basic physics of correlated electron systems by using LDA, GGA, DFT+U, GW and LDA+DMFT based density functional theory.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sudhir/']


<li>Use of density functional theory in improving the functionality of the existing functional materials and designing the technologically important new materials.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sudhir/']


<h3>Academic Qualifications</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sudhir/']


 <li>M. Sc. (Physics) (2002): School of Physical Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sudhir/']


 <li>Ph. D. (Physics) (2007): UGC - DAE Consortium for Scientific Research, Indore, India</li></ul></div></div>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sudhir/', 'http://www.iitmandi.ac.in/institute/faculty_bs.html', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ajay/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~prem/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ravi/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~chayan/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~achakraborty/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']

␀␀$d␀a$gdI]␀␀;␀␀;␀␀;␀␀;␀␀;␀␀;␀␀;␀␀;␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀hO␀␀h$8␀␀hP!␀mH␀nH␀uj␀␀␀␀h^␀Uh^␀2␀1h:pO␀/ =!"#$%␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀j␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀v␀␀v␀␀v␀␀v␀␀v␀␀v␀␀v␀␀v␀␀v␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀>␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀␀␀␀6␀␀6␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀␀␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀h␀␀H␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀6␀␀␀␀6␀␀2␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀ l␀4␀␀␀a␀␀␀␀␀␀(␀k ␀(␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀0␀N␀o␀ ␀L␀i␀s␀t␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀8␀O␀␀8␀␀␀␀[O␀␀␀␀a␀p␀p␀l␀e␀-␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀-␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀␀␀␀8␀B@␀8␀␀␀[O␀␀␀	␀B␀o␀d␀y␀ ␀T␀e␀x␀t␀␀␀␀␀d␀a$␀␀␀P␀␀P␀␀␀[O␀␀␀␀B␀o␀d␀y␀ ␀T␀e␀x␀t␀ ␀C␀h␀a␀r␀␀␀␀CJ␀OJ␀␀PJ␀␀QJ␀␀^J␀␀aJ␀tHj␀@␀"j␀␀␀[O␀ ␀L␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀P␀a␀r␀a␀g␀r␀a␀p␀h␀␀␀␀␀F!␀dh␀␀*$␀^a$m$␀␀B*mH	@ph␀␀␀␀sH	@tH	␀4␀␀␀24␀	␀[O␀0␀H␀e␀a␀d␀e␀r␀␀␀␀␀␀H$␀␀␀J␀␀AJ␀␀[O␀0␀H␀e␀a␀d␀e␀r␀ ␀C␀h␀a␀r␀␀␀␀CJ␀OJ␀␀PJ␀␀QJ␀␀^J␀␀aJ␀tH4␀ @␀R4␀␀[O␀0␀F␀o␀o␀t␀e␀r␀␀␀␀␀␀H$␀␀␀J␀␀aJ␀␀␀[O␀0␀F␀o␀o␀t␀e␀r␀ ␀C␀h␀a␀r␀␀␀␀CJ␀OJ␀␀PJ␀␀QJ␀␀^J␀␀aJ␀tH`␀␀q`␀␀␀[O␀␀␀H␀e␀a␀d␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀1␀ ␀C␀h␀a␀r␀␀␀+␀5B*CJ␀OJ␀PJ␀␀QJ␀\^J␀␀aJ␀ph6_␀tH␀B␀oB␀␀␀␀"␀␀␀␀a␀p␀p␀l␀e␀-␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀r␀t␀e␀d␀-␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀␀␀␀␀␀o␀␀␀␀"␀␀␀␀i␀l␀␀␀␀␀4␀O␀4␀␀␀␀Y␀␀␀␀c␀i␀t␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀v␀o␀l␀u␀m␀e␀␀␀␀␀(␀O␀(␀␀␀␀F␀␀␀␀s␀l␀u␀g␀-␀d␀o␀i␀␀␀␀␀*␀O␀*␀␀␀␀n4y␀␀␀	␀m␀a␀i␀n␀t␀i␀t␀l␀e␀␀␀␀␀4␀U@␀4␀	␀␀K␀0	␀H␀y␀p␀e␀r␀l␀i␀n␀k␀␀␀	␀>*ph␀␀␀␀PK␀␀␀␀␀!␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀[Content_Types].xmlj0Er(Iw},-j4	wP-t#b{UTU^hd})*1P'	^W0)T9<l#$yi};~@(Hu*Dz/0$X3aZ,D0j~3b~i>3\`?/[G\!-Rk.s..a?␀␀␀PK␀␀␀␀␀!␀␀␀␀6␀␀␀␀␀_rels/.relsj0}Q%v/C/}␀(h"O

␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀2␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀!␀␀h^h`5␀6␀CJ␀OJ␀␀PJ␀␀QJ␀␀^J␀␀aJ␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`o(␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`Lo(␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀O^O`o(␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`o(␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`Lo(␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`o(␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`o(␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀_L^_`Lo(␀␀␀.␀

␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀$␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀h^h`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀8^8`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀	^	`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀xL^x`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀H^H`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀"␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀ ␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`5␀o(␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀pL^p`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@^@`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀L^`L␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^`␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀PL^P`L␀␀.␀)␀␀␀j␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀{KF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Gk~␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀zM␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀z/@␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀`V␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀xSN␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀(8␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Z␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀fS.␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀|␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀^h␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀=EOH␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀di␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀#;P(␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀"R␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀P~␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀;0a␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀R(␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀e␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀ti␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀%8␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀6a␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀SY␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀h},␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀(,␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀(wIs␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀tQOO␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀6#]␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀+g␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀<6o␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀eOM␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀9?X␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀>+␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀@e5␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀8␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀eOM␀␀␀␀8i␀␀␀eOM␀␀␀␀8i␀␀␀eOM␀␀␀␀8i␀␀␀@I6␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀+␀␀␀␀␀␀.␀␀␀␀␀␀*␀␀␀␀␀␀&␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀&␀␀␀␀J3␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀P:␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀N␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀2␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀	␀␀	␀	␀ ␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀ ␀␀␀␀␀,␀␀␀␀␀8␀␀␀␀␀@␀␀␀␀␀H␀␀␀␀␀P␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀user␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Normal␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀iitmandi␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀37␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Microsoft Office Word␀␀␀@␀␀␀␀\␀␀␀@␀␀␀␀H@␀␀␀␀S␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀,␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀.␀+,D␀␀␀.␀+,,␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀h␀␀␀␀␀␀p␀␀␀␀␀␀|␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀]␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀3␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Title␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀ ␀␀␀␀␀␀8␀␀␀␀␀␀@␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀_PID_HLINKS␀␀␀␀␀␀A␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Z␀P␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀%␀␀␀h␀t␀t␀p␀:␀/␀/␀d␀x␀.␀d␀o␀i␀.␀o␀r␀g␀/␀1␀0␀.␀1␀0␀3␀9␀/␀C␀4␀E␀E␀0␀1␀7␀5␀9␀E␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀)␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀	␀␀␀

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~tulika/']


(September 15, 2011) (Cover Page Article)<br>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~tulika/']


(This is the first report of the complete genome sequence of novel and yet unculturable microbe SFB, which is known to play an important role in regulating intestinal immunity. The study also helped in proposing the possible mechanism of its action.)</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~tulika/']


<li><b>Expression of Conjoined Genes: Another Mechanism for Gene Regulation in Eukaryotes</b>. <b>Prakash T</b>, Sharma VK, Adati N, Ozawa R, Kumar N, Nishida Y, Fujikake T, Takeda T, Taylor TD. <b>PLoS One</b> 2010 5(10), e13284.<br>(First report on thorough identification and characterization of a novel type of gene found in eukaryotic genomes. The study resulted in the curation of the first comprehensive web resource of CGs from human genome and in proposing the various roles they can play.)</li>

<h3>Academic Career</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>Ph.D (Exp. Med.) Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research, Chandigarh, 1977</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']


<li>M.Sc.(Exp. Biol.) Saurashtra University, Rajkot, 1971</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']


<li>B.Sc.(Zool., Bot.Chem.) Punjab University, Chandigarh, 1969</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']


<li>Emeritus Scientist, Defence Institute of Physiology and Allied Sciences, Lucknow Road, Timarpur, Delhi, May 2009-June 2010.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']


<li>Director, Directorate of Life Sciences, DRDO Bhawan, Rajaji Marg, New Delhi March 2007 - April 2009.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']


<li>Scientist 'G', Programme Director 'Charak' , Head, Department of Endocrinology and Metabolism, Biochemistry, Immunology and Molecular Biology, Defence Institute of Physiology and Allied Sciences, Lucknow Road, Timarpur, Delhi, July 2002 - Dec 2006.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sawhneyrc/']

<h3>Research Interest</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']


<li>Quantum Optics</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']


<li>Quantum Information</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']


<li>Nanophotonics</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']


<li>Mesoscopic Physics</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']


<li>PhD from Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, India.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']


<li>MSc (Physics) from Agra University, Agra, India.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~ppathak/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~chayan/']


<li>Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty T.  (2004): "Hydrogen bond induced vibronic mode mixing in benzoic acid dimmer".  Trombay Symposium on Radiation and photochemistry (TSRP-2004), Bhaba Atomic Research Centre, Mumbai, India, February 79.  p 187</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~chayan/']


<li>Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty T.  (2003): "Vibronic mode mixing in hydrogen-bonded dimers of benzoic acid and substituted benzoic acid: Laser-induced fluorescence study in supersonic jet". ['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~chayan/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>Ph.D. (in Experimental Condensed Matter Physics): UGC-DAE Consortium for Scientific Research, Indore, India.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>M.Sc. (in Physics): Calcutta University, Kolkata, India.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


   <li>Magnetic, transport and thermodynamic properties of oxides and rare earth intermetallics; nanostructured magnetic oxides and intermetallics; low dimensional and frustrated magnetic compounds; functional materials like mutiferroics, magnetic refrigerant materials, materials exhibiting colossal magnetoresistance, shape memory alloys </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>Assistant Professor, School of Basic Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Mandi, India (from 2013)</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>Post Doctoral Fellow, Osaka University, Osaka, Japan [2012-2013]</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>Post Doctoral Fellow, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Mumbai, India [2009-2012]   </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>Post Doctoral Fellowship, Osaka University, Japan (funded by NEDO), 2012</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>Post Doctoral Fellowship, TIFR, India, 2009</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~kaustav/']


<li>GATE, India 2002</li>

<h2 class="page_heading">Prof. Lalit Malhotra</h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']

<h3>Field of Specialisation</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>Thin Film Physics and Technology</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>Amorphous Semiconductors, Charcogenide glasses, Selective Coating.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>Dilute magnetic semiconductors, solid state sensors, hydrogenated amorphous silicon and transport conductors.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>B.Sc.(Phy. Chem. Math) in 1963 from Punjab/Govt. Degree College, Mandi</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>M.Sc.(Phy.) in 1966 from IIT Delhi</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>M.Tech.(Solid State Physics) in 1968 from IIT Delhi</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>Ph.D(Phy.) in 1971 from IIT Delhi</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']


<li>INSA-JSPS Fellowship  1982</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~lalitmlhtr/']

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


      <li>Research project entitled &quot;<b>Advanced computational studies of dynamic phenomena in magnetic nano-materials</b>&quot; under &quot;2008 India- European commission coordinated (joint) call for proposal in Computational Material Science&acirc;&euro;&#157; program.  Collaborating institutes with in India are: SN Bose Institute, Kolkata, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Indian Institute of Sciences Bangalore and IIT Mandi, Mandi. The Collaborating partners from Europe are: Univ of Exeter in UK, Univ of Southampton, UK, Univ of Ferrara, Italy and AMU, Poland. The starting date of the project is June 1, 2009. The project was for three years but extended till March, 2013. </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


      <li>Research project entitled &quot;<b>Computational engineering of nano materials</b>&quot; is currently running under Nano Mission scheme of Department of Science &amp; Technology, Government of India. The project started on Sept 1, 2009. The project was for three years but it is extended till Feb 2013. </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


      <li>The research project entitled &quot;<b>Structured Programming through e-Learning</b>&quot; is sanctioned under International Higher Education Programme of British Council. The partner institutes are IIT Mandi, IIT Madras and University of Southampton, UK. The starting date of the project is Sept 1, 2012.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


      <li>The collaborative project &quot;<b>India-UK Advanced Technology Centre (IU-ATC)</b>&quot; is sanctioned to a consortium of Institutes in India and UK. IIT Mandi is one partner in this consortium. Starting date of the project is Aug 1, 2012.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


        <p><b><i>My role in all these projects: Principal Investigator</i></b></p>

  <h3>Centers and labs set up in IIT Mandi </h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


  <div class="data">

      <li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


        <h4>Center for Innovative Technologies for Himalayan Region (CITHR)</h4>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


      </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~padman/pubs.html']


CITHR is set up at IIT Mandi under the DST sanctioned project for doing the Scoping study to set up CSTRI Center at IIT Mandi. This is new scheme of DST to promote technology penetration in rural India. The activity started on Sept 1, 2012.<br />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


  <h4>Aakash Application Development Lab (AADL)</h4>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


AADL is set up for developing various  application oriented projects on android platform entitled &quot; Aakash Application Development Lab (AADL): Applications for Scalable Teaching in Engineering&quot; sanctioned through the lead Institute, IIT Madras, under the Centrally Sponsored Plan Scheme of <b>National Mission on Education through Information and Communication Technology</b>. Starting date of the project is Aug 1, 2012.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']


    </ul>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/']

	<title>Research Publications</title>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


							<h1>Recent Research Publications</h1>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


							<ul id="sites">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Effective Mass and Band Gap of Strained Graphene</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">Pankaj Kumar, R. Skomski, P. Manchanda, A. Kashyap and P. A. Dowben</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/graphene_band.png" alt="Img" height="242" width="342" align="right" hspace="30"></a>								
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										The effective mass of strained graphene is investigated by tight-binding and density-functional theory calculations. For graphene strained in the zigzag direction, we find a strong anisotropy in the effective mass near the gap opening, with an abrupt increase of the effective mass at the critical strain in one direction and a smooth variation perpendicular to it. There is no band-gap opening for isotropic strain, but at an expansive strain of about 28%, the lower edge of the s-band reaches the Fermi level and makes the graphene metallic.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1567173913003787">Curr. Appl. Phys. 14, S136 (2014)</a></h3><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Permanent magnetism of intermetallic compounds between light and heavy transition-metal elements</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">P. Kumar, A. Kashyap, B. Balamurugan, J. E. Shield, D. J. Sellmyer and R. Skomski</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/jpcm.png" alt="Img" height="222" width="400" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										First-principle calculations are used to investigate intrinsic magnetic properties of intermetallicalloys of the type <i>XM<sub>n</sub></i>, where <i>X</i> is a 4<i>d</i> or 5<i>d</i> element and <i>M</i> is Fe or Co. Emphasis is on the hexagonal C14 Laves-phase 1:2 and 1:5 alloys, the latter crystallizing in the CaCu<sub>5</sub> structure. These series are of interest in permanent magnetism from fundamental and practical viewpoints, respectively. In the former, the unit cells
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


form a prototypical motif where a heavy atom with high spin-orbit coupling and magnetocrystalline anisotropy is surrounded by many somewhat smaller <i>M</i> atoms with high magnetization, and the latter are Laves-phase derivatives of renewed interest in permanent magnetism. Our DFT calculations predict magnetic moments, magnetizations, and anisotropies, as well as the calculation of formation energies. The results are analyzed across the 4<i>d</i> and 5<i>d</i> series, especially with respect to hybridization effects between 3<i>d</i> and 4<i>d</i>/5<i>d</i> bands.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://iopscience.iop.org/0953-8984/26/6/064209/article?fromSearchPage=true">J. Phys. Cond. Matt. 26, 064209 (2014)</a></h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Magnetoelectric effect in Fe linear chains on Pt(001)</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">P. Manchanda, R. Skomski, A. Prabhakar and A. Kashyap</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/mae-chain.png" alt="Img" height="160" width="400" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										The effect of an electric eld on the magnetic properties of Fe chains on Pt(001) is investigated by rst-principle calculations. The calculated magnetic anisotropy of the chains yields a preferential
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


magnetization perpendicular to the surface. We predict a linear change in the Fe magnetic moment as a function of the external electric eld, which is due to spin-dependent screening of electrons. In the presence of electric eld, we also obtain an enhancement in magnetic anisotropy as well as an orbital-moment anisotropy. The enhancement in magnetic anisotropy is due to a change in the <i>d</i>-electron occupancy of the surface atoms.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/jap/115/17/10.1063/1.4868187">J. Appl. Phys. 115, 17C733 (2014)</a></h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Inspired by nature: investigating tetrataenite for permanent magnet applications</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">L. H. Lewis, A. Mubarok, E. Poirier, N. Bordeaux, P. Manchanda, A. Kashyap, R. Skomski, J. Goldstein, F. E. Pinkerton, R. K. Mishra, R. C. Kubic Jr., K. Barmak</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/jpcm-lewis.PNG" alt="Img" height="300" width="300" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										Chemically ordered L1<sub>0</sub>-type FeNi, also known as tetrataenite, is under investigation as a rare-earth-free advanced permanent magnet. Correlations between crystal structure, microstructure and magnetic properties of naturally occurring tetrataenite with a slightly Fe-rich composition (~Fe<sub>55</sub>Ni<sub>44</sub>) obtained from the meteorite NWA 6259 are reported and augmented with computationally derived results. The tetrataenite microstructure exhibits three mutually orthogonal crystallographic variants of the L1<sub>0</sub> structure that reduce its remanence; nonetheless, even in its highly unoptimized state tetrataenite provides a room-temperature coercivity of 95.5 kA m<sup>1</sup> (1200 Oe), a Curie temperature of at least 830 K and a largely temperature-independent anisotropy that preliminarily point to a theoretical magnetic energy product exceeding (BH)<sub>max</sub> = 335 kJ m<sup>3</sup> (42 MG Oe) and approaching those found in today's best rare-earth-based magnets.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://iopscience.iop.org/0953-8984/26/6/064213">J. Phys. Cond. Matt. 26, 064213 (2014)</a></h3><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html"><i>Ab-Initio</i> study of anisotropy and nonuniaxial anisotropy coefficients in Pd nanochains</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">Pankaj Kumar, Ralph Skomski, Priyanka Manchanda and Arti Kashyap</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/pk-cpl.png" alt="Img" height="160" width="400" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										Orbital moments and magnetocrystalline anisotropies of linear, ladder, and zigzag chains of Pd are investigated by first-principle calculations. For each geometry, we have determined the spin and orbital moments, the orbital-moment direction, and the magnetocrystalline anisotropy energy (MAE) as a function of the spin direction. The second- and fourth-order anisotropy coefficients have been determined, and there are generally strong nonuniaxial contributions, yielding a saddle point in the energy landscape of the zigzag nanobelt. For some directions, spin (S) and orbital moment (L) are strongly noncollinear. In the zigzag and belt chains, the maximum angle between spin and orbital moment is about 23<sup>o</sup>, but for the monatomic chain, we find an unexpected continuous change in the angle, covering the whole range between 0<sup>o</sup> and 180<sup>o</sup>.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0009261413009603">Chem. Phys. Lett. 583, 109 (2013)</a></h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Magnetoelectric effect in organometallic vanadiumbenzene wires</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">Priyanka Manchanda, Pankaj Kumar, Ralph Skomski, Arti Kashyap</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/v-benzene.png" alt="Img" height="200" width="300" align="right" hspace="85"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										The magnetism of organometallic vanadiumbenzene [V(C6H6)]<sub></sub> nanowires in an electric field has been investigated by density functional calculations. In the absence of an applied external electric field,[V(C6H6)]<sub></sub> is found to be ferromagnetic (quasi-half metallic), with a moment of 0.92 Bohr magneton per unit cell and an applied electric field enhances this value substantially, to 1.32 Bohr magneton in a field of 1.8 eV/Angstrom. The electric
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


field also changes the preferential magnetization direction (easy-axis direction), from perpendicular to the wire to parallel to the wire. This transition occurs in an electric field of 1.0 eV/.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0009261413003424">Chem. Phys. Lett. 568, 121 (2013)</a></h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html"><i>Ab-initio</i> study of free standing TiO<sub>2</sub> clusters: Stability and magnetism</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">T. H. Rana, Pankaj Kumar, A. K. Solanki, R. Skomski, and A. Kashyap</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/tushar-jap.PNG" alt="Img" height="200" width="300" align="right" hspace="85"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										We report the structural behavior of nanoscale Titanium Dioxide (TiO<sub>2</sub>) clusters as well as their magnetic properties by varying the cluster size with the help of ground state geometries. The clusters of atomic scale rutile (TiO<sub>2</sub>)<sub>n</sub>, where <i>n</i>=1-11, have been considered and geometrically stabilized through the Density Functional Theory as implemented in Vienna <i>ab-initio</i> Simulation Package. It is being observed that as the size of cluster increases from <i>n</i>=2 to 11, the total energy decreases. The results of formation energy reveal the fact that as the cluster grows, it moves towards the stability and it is observed that <i>n</i>=11 is the most stable structure. The stabilized clusters are different in geometries and co-ordination numbers. Finally, all the clusters have been investigated with self consistent treatment of spin orbit coupling for magnetism studies. The magnetic properties of free clusters depict oscillatory behavior for magnetic moment with respect
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


to the cluster size.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/jap/113/17/10.1063/1.4799616">J. Appl. Phys. 113, 17B526 (2013);</a></h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">HfCo<sub>7</sub>-based Rare-Earth-free Permanent-Magnet Alloys</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">B. Das, B. Balamurugan, P.Kumar, R. Skomski, V.R. Shah, J. E. Shield, A. Kashyap and D. J. Sellmyer</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/hfco7.png" alt="Img" height="300" width="300" align="right" hspace="85"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										This study presents the structural and magnetic properties of melt-spun HfCo<sub>7</sub>, HfCo<sub>7-x</sub>Fe<sub>x</sub> (0.25 x1), and HfCo<sub>7</sub>Si<sub>x</sub> (0.2 x1.2) alloys. Appreciable permanent-magnet properties with magnetic anisotropy constant K1=10-15 Mergs/cm<sup>3</sup>, magnetic polarization J<sup>s</sup>=7.2-10.6 kG, and coercivities H<sub>c</sub> = 0.5 - 3.0 kOe were obtained by varying the composition of these alloys. Structural analysis reveals that the positions of x-ray diffraction peaks of HfCo<sub>7</sub> show good agreement with those corresponding to an orthorhombic structure having lattice parameters of about a = 4.7189 , b = 4.2783  and c = 8.0705 . Based on these results, a model crystal structure for HfCo<sub>7</sub> is proposed and also used to estimate the magnetic properties of HfCo<sub>7</sub> using density functional calculations, which agree with the experimental results.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpls/abs_all.jsp?arnumber=6558898&tag=1">IEEE Trans. Magn. 49, 3330 (2013);</a></h3><br /><br /><br />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Predicting the Future of Permanent-Magnet Materials</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">Ralph Skomski , Priyanka Manchanda , PankajKumar , B. Balamurugan , Arti Kashyap , and D. J. Sellmyer</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/predicting-ieee.PNG" alt="Img" height="250" width="300" align="right" hspace="85"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										This study presents the structural and magnetic properties of melt-spun HfCo<sub>7</sub>, HfCo<sub>7-x</sub>Fe<sub>x</sub> (0.25 x1), and HfCo<sub>7</sub>Si<sub>x</sub> (0.2 x1.2) alloys. Appreciable permanent-magnet properties with magnetic anisotropy constant K1=10-15 Mergs/cm<sup>3</sup>, magnetic polarization J<sup>s</sup>=7.2-10.6 kG, and coercivities H<sub>c</sub> = 0.5 - 3.0 kOe were obtained by varying the composition of these alloys. Structural analysis reveals that the positions of x-ray diffraction peaks of HfCo<sub>7</sub> show good agreement with those corresponding to an orthorhombic structure having lattice parameters of about a = 4.7189 , b = 4.2783  and c = 8.0705 . Based on these results, a model crystal structure for HfCo<sub>7</sub> is proposed and also used to estimate the magnetic properties of HfCo<sub>7</sub> using density functional calculations, which agree with the experimental results.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpls/abs_all.jsp?arnumber=6558898&tag=1">IEEE Trans. Magn. 49, 3330 (2013);</a></h3><br />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Ultrahard Magnetic Nanostructures</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">P. K. Sahota, Y. Liu, R. Skomski, P. Manchanda, R. Zhang, M. Franchin, H. Fangohr, G. C. Hadjipanayis, A. Kashyap and D. J. Sellmyer</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/ultra-hard.PNG" alt="Img" height="200" width="400" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										The performance of hard-magnetic nanostructures is investigated by analyzing the size and geometry dependence of thin-film hysteresis loops. Compared to bulk magnets, weight and volume are much less important, but we find that the energy product remains the main figure of merit down to very small features sizes. However, hysteresis loops are much easier to control on small length scales, as epitomized by Fe-Co-Pt thin films with magnetizations of up to 1.78 T and coercivities of up to 2.52 T. Our numerical and analytical calculations show that the feature size and geometry have a big effect on the hysteresis loop. Layered soft regions, especially if they have a free surface, are more harmful to coercivity and energy product than spherical inclusions. In hard-soft nanocomposites, an additional complication is provided by the physical properties of the hard phases. For a given soft phase, the performance of a hard-soft composite is determined by the parameter (M<sub>s</sub>M<sub>h</sub>)/K<sub>h</sub>. 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/jap/111/7/10.1063/1.3679453">J. Appl. Phys. 111, 07E345 (2012)</a></h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Magnetoelectric Effect in L1<sub>0</sub>-CoPd Thin Films</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">P. Manchanda, R. Skomski, A. K. Solanki, P. S. A. Kumar and A. Kashyap</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/copd-man.PNG" alt="Img" height="120" width="400" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										The effect of an applied electric field on the magnetic properties of L1<sub>0</sub>-ordered CoPd thin films is investigated by first-principle calculations. Both the magnetic moment and the magnetocrystalline anisotropy of the surface atoms are changed by the electric field, but the net effect depends on the surface termination. The magnetocrystalline anisotropy switches from in-plane to perpendicular in the presence of external electric field. Typical magnetic-moment changes are 0.1 <sub>B</sub> per eV/. The main mechanism is the shift of the Fermi level, but the anisotropy change also reflects a crystal-field change due to incomplete screening.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpls/abs_all.jsp?arnumber=6027697&tag=1">IEEE Tran. Magn.Chem. 47, 4391 (2011)</a></h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Interatomic exchange in Mn-doped IIIV semiconductors</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">Vinit Sharma, Priyanka Manchanda, Pankaj K. Sahota, Ralph Skomski and Arti Kashyap</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/mnn-sharma.PNG" alt="Img" height="300" width="400" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										Density-functional calculations are used to determine the electronic structure and magnetic properties of dilute magnetic semiconductors with the composition X<sub>1x</sub>Mn<sub>x</sub>N (X = Al, Ga, In, x = 6.25% and 12.5%). Emphasis is on the interatomic exchange as a function of the MnMn distance. Our superlattice calculations show that the Mn dopants are spin-polarized with a half-metallic band gap and a magnetic moment of 4 <sub>B</sub> per Mn atom at x = 6.25 and 12.5%. The Mn (3d) bands lie in the band gap but partially hybridize with valence band or N 2p electrons, depending on the group-III element and on the spin direction. To calculate the exchange interaction parameters Jij, we have used a Green-function approach. The interaction between Mn atoms extends over several interatomic interactions and is mediated by nitrogen (2p) electrons. The exchange is always ferromagnetic and largest for the first nearest neighbors, but substantial ferromagnetic interactions persist over MnMn distances up to sixth nearest neighbors in the considered supercell.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://digitalcommons.unl.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1089&context=physicsskomski">J. Mag. Magn. Mat. 324, 786 (2011)</a></h3><br /><br /><br />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								<li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h2><a href="publications.html">Electronic, magnetic and transport properties of Co<sub>2</sub>TiZ (Z=Si, Ge and Sn): A first-principle study</a></h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:18px">Vinit Sharmaa, A.K. Solanki and Arti Kashyap</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<a href="publications.html"><img src="images/co2tiz-vinit.jpg" alt="Img" height="300" width="400" align="right" hspace="30"></a>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									<p align="justify">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


										We have studied the electronic structure, magnetic and transport properties of some Co based full Heusler alloys, namely Co<sub>2</sub>TiZ (Z=Si, Ge and Sn), in the frame work of first-principle calculations. The calculations show that Co<sub>2</sub>TiZ (X=Si, Ge and Sn) are to be half-metallic compounds with a magnetic moment of 2 <sub>B</sub>, well consistent with the SlaterPauling rule. The electronic structure results reveal that Co<sub>2</sub>TiZ has the high density of states at the Fermi energy in the majority-spin state and show 100% spin polarization. Our results also suggest that both the electronic and magnetic properties in these compounds are intrinsically related to the appearance of the minority-spin gap. The origin of energy gap in the minority-spin states is discussed in terms of the electron splitting of Z (Z=Si, Ge and Sn) and 3d Co atoms and also the dd hybridization between the Co and Ti atoms. The transport properties of these materials are discussed on the basis of Seebeck coefficients, electrical conductivity coefficients and thermal conductivity coefficients.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


<h3 style="color:#316e66;font-size:14px"><a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0304885310002994">J. Mag. Magn. Mat. 322, 2922 (2010)</a></h3><br /><br />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


									</p>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']


								</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~arti/magmat.html']

<title>Dr. Sarita Azad &lt;&lt; IIT Mandi</title>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Sarita Azad</h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<div id="data_top"><img src="images/sarita.jpg" alt="Dr. Sarita Azad" />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<th>Phone : </th>	<td>01905-237928</td></tr>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<tr><th>EMail : </th>	
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<td>sarita[at]iitmandi[dot]ac[dot]in</td></tr>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<th>Address : </th>	<td>School of Basic Science</td>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<ul><b>My major interests have been analysing real-time data from various interdisciplinary fields by employing a combination of techniques, ranging from time series analysis to deterministic and stochastic models, to pursue this aim.</b><br/><br/>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li><b>Epidemics and Bio-Surveillance</b>: Mosquito-transmitted viral diseases like malaria are among the top infectious killing diseases in India and worldwide. I work on developing algorithms for modelling disease spread; understanding their temporal and spatial patterns; finding climate predictors; and developing social networks for surveillance purposes.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li><b>Indian Monsoon Rainfall</b>: The monsoon is a stochastic process. Area of interest is the analysis of rainfall data for developing effective prediction methods using time-frequency and probabilistic estimation methods. Also, I am statistically analysing the contemporaneous relationship between the intensity of the Indian monsoon and run-off in the major rivers of Himalayan Basin.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li><b>International affairs and Policy analysis</b>: The focus is on analysing social trends and international relations using mathematical (game theory) and statistical models. The techniques like social networks are used for finding community structures in social interactions and security related studies.</li></ul>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<div  class="data_field large_df">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li>Ph.D (2008) : Department of Applied Mathematics, Faculty of Technology, Delhi University, India, worked under the supervision of Prof. Roddam Narasimha, (FRS) at Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li>M.Sc (1999): Department of Mathematics, IIT Delhi, India.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li>B.Sc Hons. (1997) : Department of Mathematics, Delhi University (DU), New Delhi, India. </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<div  class="data_field large_df">
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li> President's Award for Excellence -2011 at the Institute for Defence Studies and Analyses (IDSA), New Delhi.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<li>Dr. D. C. Pavate Fellowship-2009 for visiting Department of Applied Mathematics and Theoretical Physics, University of Cambridge, UK. </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


 </ul></div></div>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~sarita/']


<div  class="data_field large_df">

Abu T. Khan, Samimul  Islam, Lokman H. Choudhury  and Subrata Ghosh. Tetrahedron Lett. 2004, 45, 9617-9621.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~subrata/']


</li><li>Cupric Sulfate Pentahydrate (CuSO4.5H2O): A Mild and Efficient Catalyst for Tetrahydropyranylation/Depyranylation of Alcohols and Phenols. Abu T. Khan, Lokman H. Choudhury and Subrata Ghosh. Tetrahedron Lett. 2004, 45, 7891-7894.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~subrata/']


</li><li>A Simple and Useful Synthetic Protocol for Selective Deprotection of tert-Butyldimethylsilyl (TBS) Ethers.   Abu T. Khan, Subrata Ghosh and Lokman H. Choudhury. Eur. J. Org. Chem. 2004, 2198-2204.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~subrata/']


</li><li>A Simple and Practical Synthetic Protocol for Acetalisation, Thioacetalisation and Transthioacetalisation of Carbonyl Compounds under Solvent-Free Conditions. Abu T. Khan, Ejabul Mondal, Subrata Ghosh, and Samimul Islam. Eur. J. Org. Chem. 2004, 2002-2009. 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~subrata/']


</li><li>A Highly Efficient and Chemoselective Synyhetic Protocol for Tetrahydropyr-anylation/Depyranylation of Alcohols and Phenols. Abu T. Khan, Ejabul Mondal and  Ballav M. Bora, Subrata Ghosh. Eur. J. Org. Chem. 2003, 4113-4117. 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~subrata/']


</ol></div>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~subrata/']

<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Anand Srivastava </h2>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<div id="data_top"><img src="images/anand.jpg" height="200px" alt="Dr. Anand Srivastava" />
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<td>anand[at]iitmandi[dot]ac[dot]in</td></tr>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<td>School of Computing and Electrical Engineering</td>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~samar/']


<td>Mandi, Himachal Pradesh - 175001</td></tr>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~samar/']


<td>+91-1905-237991</td></tr>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<ul><li>Optical Core and Access networks</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Optical processing</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Energy aware optical networks</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<h3>Research Areas</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/', 'http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~samar/']


<ul><li>High speed optical access networks including long-reach broadband access network</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Optical access network architecture, design, control, and management</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Future PON architectures, including WDM-PON, OFDMA-PON and Hybrid PON</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Energy efficient optical access networks</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Ph.D. Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, 2002</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>M.Tech. Optical Communications, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, 1983</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Post Grad. Diploma in Management, All India Management Association, 1996 </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<h3>Industry Experience</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Indian Telephone Industries (ITI), (1983-1985)</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Bharat Electonics Lab (BEL), (1985-1989)</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Center for Development of Telematics (CDOT),
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Telecom Technology Center of Govt. of India, (Director and CDOT Board Member),  (1989-2008)</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>Alcatel-Lucent India, (2009-2012)</li>          
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<h3>Major accomplishments in Industries </h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<h4>CDOT (1989-2008)</h4>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


As a member of the C-DOT Board, contributed effectively towards preparation of the vision document of C-DOT i.e., 'Technical and Financial Road Map' which aims at making the organization self reliant.</li><br>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


In accordance with the objective laid down in the vision document, I ensured alignment of the mission of the organization with the changing market scenario. While conceptualizing the projects and selecting the technologies for development, market competitiveness of the end product has always been the main priority, which was realized with commercial deployment of a number of products during this period.</li> 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<br><li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


In order to ensure the quality as well as timely and cost effective delivery of the products, strict adherence to CMMI processes was ensured in all the stages of development cycle.</li><br>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


During my stay in CDOT, I provided technical leadership and motivation to extremely qualified teams of about 200 engineers engaged in development  of major projects in the areas of Telecom Security Systems, Network Management System, Intelligent Networks, Operations Support Systems, Access networks (GPON), Optical Technology based Networks etc.). Majority of the projects undertaken during the period were carried out successfully and commercially deployed in the public network.</li> 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<h4>Indigenously Developed Projects</h4>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<b>Transfer of Technology of STM-1 system to Iran Telecom Research Center (ITRC), Iran</b>: STM-1 system was successfully developed in CDOT and technology was transferred to TRC Iran on commercial terms.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<b>Local Switch Network Management System</b>: Nation-wide deployment of Local Switch NMS in BSNL/MTNL network for all types of technologies viz. EWSD, AXE, OCB, E10B, C-DOT and 5ESS. </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<b>GSM NMS</b>: Deployed in BSNL Network to monitor the performance of mobile switches of different technologies. Supports switches of Siemens, Lucent, Ericssion and Motorola. These switches are being monitored at National level.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<b>TAX NMS</b>: TAX NMS solution to cover TAX exchanges of all Telecom Circles in BSNL Network (Approx. 350+) has been developed and deployed in the country.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li><b>Subscriber Management</b>: Subscriber Management for BSNL PSTN network.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li><b>Intelligent Network (IN) Systems</b>: CDOT designed IN platform has been giving service to MTNL Delhi and Mumbai network since 2000. Up-gradation were continuously done as and when new requirements were received.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Operation Support System (OSS)</b>:  Indigenous solution developed for Clearing House, roaming management between BSNL and MTNL and is being maintained and operated fro CDOT premises.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<b>Call Interception and Intelligence System</b>: This system was developed for Law Enforcement Agencies (LEAs) of the country.  Law Enforcement Interception Facility (LEIF) at operator premises and Law Enforcement Monitoring Facility (LEMF) at LEA's premises were designed and developed by C-DOT. LEMF (for all GSM, CDMA and fixed line operators of Delhi) is deployed in Directorate of Enforcement.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Dense/Course Wavelength Division Multiplexing (WDM) System</b>: This high capacity optical transport system (Dense WDM) was designed and developed, system integration in full configuration of a 32 wavelengths conforming to the TEC GR was completed and commercially deployed in BSNL Network.</li> 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Gigabit Passive Optical Network (GPON)</b>: Principal architect in the development of total solution completed consisting of OLT, ONTs, EMS and NMS as per International Standards. This technology is likely to be used in Government approved National Optic Fiber Network (NOFN) which plans to connect all Gram Panchayats in the country through optical fiber cable to ensure a bandwidth of at least 100 Mbps at each Gram Panchayat
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<h4>Alcatel-Lucent India (2009-2012)</h4>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


New Product introduction in the network like VDSL, GPON, 40G/100G Optics</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Solution architecting with new products for operators</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Working with product development units and Bell Labs for feature enhancement</li> 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Long Term Network Access Architecture for Bharti-Airtel</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Technology selection for National Optical Fiber Broadband (NOFN) for India</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']

<h3>B. Tech /MS/Ph.D. Projects</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<ul><li>9 Students (2012-2013)</li><li>6 Students (2013-2014)</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>1 Student MS (2012- ) Implementation of Buffered Crossbar Switch in NS2</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<li>1 Student PhD (2012- ) Research area: Optical OFDM in PON Networks
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


<h3>Research Work Abroad</h3>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']


Carried out significant research work in the Photonics Research Lab, Nice, France, under the Indo-French Science & Technology Cooperation Program on Speciality Optical Fiber and Fiber based components for Optical Communication during 2007-2010. Other partners of this program were IIT Delhi, IIT Roorkee and CNRS Nice, France. The outcome of this research is published in international publications and will be helpful in future research activities in the areas relating to Ultra-dense WDM Systems and All Optical Networks.
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~anand/']

<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Satinder Kumar Sharma </h2>

['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li><b>VLSI Technology</b> :Synthesis and characterization of   Multiple thickness gate oxides for SOC system, 
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


High-k gate dielectric stacks charge trapping for CMOS Technology and ions irradiated scaled MOSFET for space   application, VLSI design for digital and analog circuits, reconfigurable computing, device modeling and  simulation, flexible  and  bio- compatible  integration of  nano- electronics and piezoelectric materials for MEMS devices etc. </li><br>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li><b>Nano Science and Nanotechnology</b>:   1D, 0D nanostructures of  ZnO, TiO2 , ZnS, CdSe, CdS,  Polyannaline  synthesis and  characterization of electronic, optical and magnetic properties for various applications. ZnO/PANI coaxial nanostructures for Solar cell application, Functionalized  metal/semiconductor nano-particles for Surafce Plasmon,Chemisorptions and Biological Sensors application.  Self-organized meso-patterning of polymers, polymer thin films  wetting/ dewetting and polymer nanocomposite instability etc.</li><br>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li>Faculty in school of Computing and Electrical Engineering at Indian Institute of Technology (IIT)-
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


     Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, (India). </li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li>Faculty in Electronics and Microelectronics Division at Indian Institute of Information Technology-(IIIT)-Allahabad, (India), from  2010-2012.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li>Research Scientist, in DST Unit on Nanosciences at Indian Institute of Technology (IIT)- Kanpur, (India) from 2007-2010.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li>Guest faculty, in Electronics Science Department at Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra, (India), from 2004-2006.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li>Post Doc. in Nano Science and Nanotechnology from DST Unit on Nanosciences at Indian Institute of Technology (IIT)-Kanpur from 2007-  2010.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li>Ph.D in VLSI Technology from Electronics Science Department,  Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra from 2002-2007.</li>  
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']


<li>Master in Science in Physics, Electronics Science from department of Physics, Himachal Pradesh University, Shimla from 2000-2002.</li>
['http://faculty.iitmandi.ac.in/~satinder/']
